attributes.action: Govt close venue/pub to ensure safety of public and min wage workers  - COVID-19
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the Government are forcing venues to stay open, to avoid providing them financial support they would be entitled to. They are also telling the public not to use these businesses, which is ensuring their failure and therefore loss of jobs for all their workers. 
The damage of which will last long after the epidemic has subsided.
As well as allowing the public to gather in large groups working to 
exacerbate the number of infections.
attributes.background: Government to force venues and pubs to close for the safety of public and the financial support of min wage workers. so they are eligible for insurances and subsidy.

rejection.details:
The Government announced the closure of all pubs, clubs and restaurants on Friday 20th March.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:
NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
